70I'm sorry things didn't turn out as you had hoped. Go and remember us fondly. You know, you bothered me far less than most.
64You have proven to be the greatest of heroes, and I am honored to call you friend. Thank you for bringing peace to our lives again.

68Never fear, my friend. You did the best you could.

I suspect that Diablo and Baal are now heading east, towards Kurast. You'll find them... I know you will.

46This is terrible news! Baal is in possession of one of mankind's most powerful mages, and the Lord of Terror guides his path. They must be stopped, for I am sure they mean to free their elder brother Mephisto, the Lord of Hatred, who lies imprisoned under the corrupted city of Kurast.

I fear you are walking into a great evil, but your faith can save you. May you walk in the light always.

54You're an inspiration! And such a hero that it makes me look twice as bad...

Ahh, you're OK... Hey! Just save some glory for us little guys, huh?

51This is a serious setback... It is most unfortunate that Tal Rasha has been consumed by Baal's destructive influence. There are many secrets known to the Horadrim, which could be used by Baal against us.

You must travel east by sea to Kurast and stop Diablo and Baal before they free their eldest brother, Mephisto.

Hahh... The lands of the eastern Empire are not the same as they used to be. There has been little word for some time.

Speed is of the essence. Go quickly, my friend. May the fates smile on you.
82Jerhyn tells me I should take you east to Kurast. I haven't been there for several years, but rumor has it that things are pretty grim.
51I've heard that your foe got away from you this time. Well, look at it this way... you've got the demons on the run. If you're going to be leaving, then... Well, thanks for your help.

39The Archangel Tyrael was the one who gave the Soulstones to the Horadrim two hundred and sixty years ago.

It is highly unusual for the forces of Heaven to so directly interfere with man's destiny, but Tyrael was said to act of his own volition. We have never been able to discern why.

Perhaps, he goes against the consensus of Heaven because he doubts our ability to defend ourselves, or perhaps, he sees more threat than his peers.

Where the actions of Hell often seem straightforwardly bent on destruction, the motives of Heaven are unfathomable.

Now make haste... Both Diablo and Baal must be stopped before they join with their brother, Mephisto. If the three Prime Evils unite once again, the world as we know it will be no more.

48Greetings, hero. I've heard of your exploits and... I'm quite impressed. Very few mortals are capable of dealing with the Three and their minions as you have.

My name is Natalya. I am a hunter of Evil, part of an ancient Order sworn to hunt down corrupted sorcerers.

If I could, I would gladly join your quest to stop the Three. But I must wait here for further news. I can't predict what will happen, but the danger is greater than we can know.

Until I receive my orders, I'll assist you with the information I have.

74Asheara...? Oh, she's is a tough-talking mage, but I'd wager she's never faced true Evil.

Pampering drunken mercenaries is one thing, but standing face to face with a hell-spawned demon is another.
69I've heard the name of Deckard Cain many times. He's the last of the Horadrim, and thus, I must honor him. You must be powerful, indeed, if one such as he accompanies you.
100Hratli is a master craftsman. My Order could make use of one with his unique skills.
67My Order has been keeping watch over Ormus for many years, now. He seems to champion the cause of good, but who knows what shadow lurks within his soul?

45I've not set foot in glorious Kurast for many years. But I never would have imagined it could be so corrupted.

Certainly, this must be Mephisto's work! You'd best get going, my friend. Diablo and Baal are still out there and you must find them.
62Seeing his homeland in such a state must be horrifying to Meshif. I'm surprised he's willing to remain here in order to help you.
82Asheara seems like a very tough woman. I'd be careful around her if I were you.

53Drognan told me of Hratli when we were in Lut Gholein. He said that he weaves magic into his forge and produces mystical weapons and armor.

His skills could be quite useful to you.

44Judging from his dress and strange markings, I would guess that Ormus is from the ancient Taan mage-clan. Yet none of the others here seem to know that he is a sorcerer.

The Taan were once as powerful as the Vizjerei clan, but their studies were even more secretive. I wonder what he's hiding.

49Have you met, Natalya? She appears to be a member of the Khral-Harzhek, a secret order that has been around for centuries... almost as long as the Horadrim, itself.

Her presence here makes me uneasy, for they are traditionally sworn to hunt down Magi who have betrayed the trust of their order.

I wonder why she is here.
73Ormus would like you to think him mad. Better to watch his actions than listen to his words.

33Welcome to Kurast, traveler. Few come willingly to this ancient city anymore. I hope you brought your wits with you, for sanity is in short supply here.

My name is Hratli. I am a sorcerer skilled in metal work. It'd be a pleasure to help you... I don't have many customers these days.

As you can see, the populace has been brutally decimated by the forces of Mephisto. The canals run red with blood and demons roam the land.

The wretched jungle-hell has already reclaimed much of Kurast. The only safety you'll find is here at the dockside, where a magical warding holds the jungle evils at bay... but I don't know how long it will last.

To make matters worse, the Children of Zakarum are in league with the forces of Mephisto. The Zakarum have concentrated their power in the Temple City of Travincal, located within Kurast deep in the jungle wilderness.

It's true... Their zeal is unmatched. But I say the so-called 'Warriors of Light' are nothing more than the twisted puppets of a hidden hand.

33Welcome to Kurast, young Sorceress. Few come willingly to this ancient city anymore. I hope you brought your wits with you, for sanity is in short supply here.

My name is Hratli. I am a sorcerer skilled in metal work. It'd be a pleasure to help you... I don't have many customers these days.

Though my own magic is only useful for making enchanted weapons, I'll bet yours will put an end to this terrible evil once and for all. May the spirits of Skatsim watch over and protect you.

As you can see, the populace has been brutally decimated by the forces of Mephisto. The canals run red with blood and demons roam the land.

The wretched jungle-hell has already reclaimed much of Kurast. The only safety you'll find is here at the dockside, where a magical warding holds the jungle evils at bay... but I don't know how long it will last.

To make matters worse, the Children of Zakarum are in league with the forces of Mephisto. The Zakarum have concentrated their power in the Temple City of Travincal, located within Kurast deep in the jungle wilderness.

It's true... Their zeal is unmatched. But I say the so-called 'Warriors of Light' are nothing more than the twisted puppets of a hidden hand.
48You're very brave to have come here. In the old days, mages who didn't belong to one of the great Mage Clans were hunted down as renegades. But now, the Mage Clans have little authority.
53Within the Temple City stands a tower built long ago by the Horadrim to imprison the... Well, you'll discover more about it soon enough.
60If you are another follower of Zakarum, I've told you people before I don't want your Towering Spire or anything else you have to sell!
74Some find my prices unreasonable. That is because I am unreasonable.
76You'll find that the Zakarumites have the persistence of zombies, but without the charisma.
60Asheara leads the mercenary company known as the Iron Wolves. You can hire some of them, but many are occupied securing the dockside.
74Alkor is a potion dealer given over to a life steeped in ceaseless study and dissipation.
58Ormus is a man of many mysteries. I sense strong magic about him, but he's never spoken of it to me.

49I trust you already know Meshif. But did you know that he was born and raised here?

I suspect that like many of us his spirit is near broken at the sight of Kurast's decline. Only our brand of gallows humor saves us from utter despair.
55This Cain whom you brought with you. He has the bearing of great power, yet I sense no magic about him. He is an enigma to me.
49Natalya is a quiet one. She arrived here about a week ago and has pretty much kept to herself. She's inquired about my weapons a few times, so I assume that she's a warrior of some sort.

51Well, I gave you my word, and brought you here as promised.

But by all that's still holy, I wish I'd never returned to this accursed place. This fetid jungle can't be the fair Kurast I left behind.

I don't know what all this evil is, my friend, but it's obvious that you must stop it. I only pray that you can before the jungle consumes the last vestiges of my beloved homeland.

47Being a Barbarian, I'm sure you've seen many strange sights in the northlands.

But by all that's still holy, I wish I'd never returned to this accursed place. This fetid jungle can't be the fair Kurast I left behind!

I don't know what all this evil is, my friend, but it's obvious that you must stop it. I only pray that you can before the jungle consumes the last vestiges of my beloved homeland.

If this evil isn't contained, it could spread north to your homeland, too. Then the whole world would fall under the shadow of the Three.
63It takes great courage and generosity to defend a land and a people that are not your own. Perhaps, when this curse is lifted, my people can do something for yours in return.
72I shouldn't have boasted so much about Kurast on the journey here. Oh... Much has changed since I left.
99The dockside is apparently the only civilized area left in Kurast.
88If you are planning to carry on your wild ways here, you may need the assistance of Asheara's Iron Wolf mercenaries.
75Your companion, Cain, must have known that he would be in grave danger here. You are great, indeed, to elicit such loyalty.
81Hratli seems to be the only one left here with any common sense. Yet how sensible is it to remain here?
80I went to speak with old Alkor, but I disturbed his studies. He doesn't seem to like visitors.
73Trying to get information out of Ormus is like straining water from a rock. His damned riddles are almost as confusing as our current state of affairs.
75That woman, Natalya, seems to be waiting for something important to happen. She's a strange one, I think.
68All through my childhood, Kurast was a paradise. The once perfumed air now reeks of putrefaction.

54Hello, there. You must be a great adventurer to risk coming here.

My name's Asheara, and I lead the mercenary band of mages known as the Iron Wolves. We've been hunting down demons in the jungle for months, but no matter how many of them we kill, they just keep comin'. Seems this whole place has been overrun by evil.

Rumor has it that you've come here to help. If that's true, then I'll let you hire some of my mercenaries.

But be careful... If you piss them off, they can be worse than those monsters out in the jungle.

50Hello, there. You must be an Amazon. I've heard about your people... nomadic warriors without peer.

My name's Asheara, and I lead the mercenary band of mages known as the Iron Wolves. We've been hunting down demons in the jungle for months, but no matter how many of them we kill, they just keep comin'. Seems this whole place has been overrun by evil.

Rumor has it that you've come here to help. If that's true, then I'll let you hire some of my mercenaries.

But be careful... If you piss them off, they can be worse than those monsters out in the jungle.
66Your skills are unique indeed. They are neither sorcery, nor physical, but seem to be a harmonious blend of the two. The Iron Wolves could learn much from your kind.
160Why fight fair, when you can hire some of us?
107No one comes to Kurast anymore without good reason.  You must be seeking fame and fortune.
137The Iron Wolves and I have made a good living around here lately.
110The jungle can take you down fast. Try to avoid getting trapped out there if you can.
90Hratli may be a bit too clever for his own good. Still, I'd trust his work anytime.
77Hratli thinks he's so funny. The other day he said, 'Asheara, I don't recognize you without that big gash on your face.'
97Meshif says he used to live here. I'm surprised he came back. I'll bet he wishes he hadn't.
78I invited Natalya to join the Iron Wolves and she began lecturing me about the 'dangers of magic'. Who the hell does she think she is, anyway?

61Damn it, I wish you people would just leave me alone! I...

Oh, you're new here, aren't you?

I am Alkor, the Alchemist. I dabble in potions and salves, and I can sell you some if you really need them.

But don't make a habit of coming here. I don't like to be disturbed while I'm studying!

48Damn it, I wish you people would just leave me alone! I...

Oh, you're a Necromancer, aren't you? I've heard that your kind use powerful potions and such to wake the dead and control spirits. I'd love to discuss what components you use some time.

I am Alkor, the Alchemist. I dabble in potions and salves, myself, and I can sell you some if you really need them.

...Feel free to drop by anytime.
55Even I can tell that the evil in the jungle is growing. I hope you survive out there, my pasty friend. I'd still like to discuss what components are best used in necromantic potions.
151Care to take a gander at my Grimoire?
90I've never claimed that you'd live forever after trying one of my potions! Merely that you might look as though you had.
105I keep a library of tomes - heretical, exegetical, hermeneutical and pharmaceutical.

50There was a very fat man here recently asking after the Golden Bird of Ku Y'Leh. Have you heard of it? He kept muttering about ashes. I would imagine one Golden Bird's ash-hole to be about the same as another, wouldn't you?
150I hope you don't object to my badgering the witless.

115You came here with Meshif? That old 'tour-guide to the stupid'!

I'm surprised you made it here in one piece.
98Oh, Asheara's a good customer. She buys a potion of manliness from me every week.
82Hratli's only good for making his silly magic weapons. It's not like he's got the stones to actually go out and use them on anything.
88Oh, Ormus has been talking in riddles for years. I think he does it to cover up the fact that he's got nothing intelligent to say.

38You now speak to Ormus.

He was once a great mage, but now lives like a rat in a sinking vessel. You have questions for Ormus and doubt in yourself. Ormus sees a strange dichotomy in you... as he does in all would-be heroes.

Speak to him and he may grant you wisdom in turn. Or turn from him and seek wisdom in thyself.

37You now speak to Ormus, good Paladin.

He was once a great mage, but now lives like a rat in a sinking vessel. You have questions for Ormus and doubt in yourself. Ormus sees a strange dichotomy in you... as he does in all would-be heroes.

Speak to him and he may grant you wisdom in turn. Or turn from him and seek wisdom in thyself.

68The Church which you serve is corrupted by evil. Yet the holy disciplines it taught you may yet save us all.

This is a strange time for heroes, Ormus thinks.
65Your salvation can only be reached through Hatred. A strange fate, but a true one.
52How does one destroy Destruction? How does one force Terror to flee in fear? You have great tasks ahead of you, Ormus thinks.
72The Church of Light harbors the darkest shadow of all. Tread lightly.
89When speaking of the dead, it is best to remain cryptic.
84The Travincal can be breached by the loss of one's wits, not by the use of them.
95Alkor is able to explain things much more clearly than Ormus.
58For one who spends so much time away from home, Meshif has taken Kurast's corruption the hardest.
91Asheara is both proud and self-conscious of her womanhood.
65Deckard Cain... Ormus has no time for the last son of the Horadrim. Pride led that holy Order to failure.
63Hratli suspects that Ormus is a mage. He can suspect whatever he wants, Ormus will not show him the true magic.

53Back in Lut Gholein Meshif told me he had a fondness for jade figurines. On his trading voyages he collected an odd assortment of such small statues.

I would show him your figurine.
160Only Deckard Cain can make sense of this.

73Praise you! That jade figurine will complete the set I was collecting.

Here! I've had this statuette of a golden bird for years, but I consider it a fair exchange.
89I'm having fun just watching you run from place to place searching for a Golden Bird. Some hero you are.

47I've read legends about a sage named Ku Y'leh, who studied the mysteries of life beyond death.

If I remember correctly, his ashes were ensconced within a golden statuette. It was a very strange tale.
134You will have to take Ku Y'leh's ashes to Alkor.
96Such a beautiful statuette... But, you'd think it would've been better cared for. There's a compartment here that's full o' dust.

73Ah, the Golden Bird of Ku Y'leh.  Thank you, my friend.

120From the ashes of Ku Y'leh I have mixed for you a potion.

94Immortality is definitely not for me.

33Never forget that your ultimate purpose here in Kurast is to destroy Mephisto. The ancient Horadrim imprisoned the Lord of Hatred inside the Guardian Tower that is located within the Temple City of Travincal.

Mephisto used this device to control the Zakarum Priests and their followers. The Orb can only be destroyed with an ancient flail imbued with the spirit of the one incorruptible priest.

Soon after his imprisonment, Mephisto worked his evil corruption on the Zakarum priesthood. All were turned to his dark ways, save one - Khalim, the Que-Hegan of the High Council.

Mephisto directed the other Council priests to slay and dismember Khalim and then scatter his remains across the Kingdom. The Priest Sankekur succeeded Khalim as Que-Hegan, eventually becoming the embodiment of Mephisto here on the mortal plane.

The corrupted High Council fashioned an Orb to control the rest of the Zakarum faithful and used their powers to hide the lair of their master from mortals.

Your task is to collect the scattered relics of Khalim - his Heart, his Brain, and his Eye. Then, using the Horadric Cube, transmute Khalim's Flail with his relics.

Once this is accomplished, you must destroy the Compelling Orb with Khalim's Will to open the way into the corrupt sanctum of Mephisto.

61You have found Khalim's Heart, and it still bears the courage to face Mephisto!

Place it in the Horadric Cube along with Khalim's other relics - the Eye, the Brain, and the Flail.

52Ahh... Khalim's Eye! Only it can reveal the true path to Mephisto.

Place the Eye in the Horadric Cube along with Khalim's other relics - the Heart, the Brain, and the Flail.

58This is most fortunate! Khalim's Brain knows Mephisto's weakness.

Place it in the Horadric Cube along with Khalim's other relics - the Eye, the Heart, and the Flail.

Place it into the Horadric Cube along with Khalim's relics - his Heart, his Brain, and his Eye. Then, transmute them to carry out Khalim's Will.

54Masterfully done, hero! You have crafted Khalim's Will. Employ it to destroy the Compelling Orb and open the way to Mephisto. 

May the true Light guide your way.

56It pains me to waste time with you, so I'll get right to the point.

There is a very special book which you must find for me. It was written long ago by a sage known as Lam Esen, who studied Skatsimi magic and the effects of the Prime Evils on the mortal world. The Black Book was lost when the Children of Zakarum took over this land.

Now, you must reclaim it without delay! Its knowledge may aid us in this dark time ahead.

73The Black Book contains powerful secrets of Skatsim, the Old Religion, long eclipsed by Zakarum.

I should warn you. The Black Book is much sought after by both good and evil. Be wary.
62The Children of Zakarum believe that the Black Book is filled with blasphemous heresy. In truth, the book may contain the secrets to our ultimate redemption.
73Oh. No one really believes that the Black Book exists. It's just a symbol of Zakarum's anti-Skatsim propaganda.
102Many things can be found in the city of Kurast. The book may be there.
54We have long sought the Black Book of Lam Esen. Rumors of its whereabouts spread as fast as jungle plagues. If you find it, take it to Alkor.
72The Black Book is a powerful source of information. The Zakarum will do everything in their power to stop you from obtaining it.
81I've heard of the Black Book. My Order's code is based on many of its passages. If you find it, I will be greatly impressed.
104Did I neglect to mention that the book contains useful information about the Prime Evils?
55Even if you find the sacred Book, you must still traverse the jungle of meaning within it. That journey could prove to be far more perilous.
56Kurast was once the greatest city in the world. Now it is hard to tell where the jungle stops and the city begins. The jungle grows rampant on the soil enriched by the blood of my fellow citizens.

68I believe I can trust you now.

When you first arrived, I suspected you a spy for the Zakarum, the false religion whose faithful are now under the sway of a mysterious power. They've made a mockery of the Old Religion of Skatsim.

62Not getting much help?

You know, people are like rugs. Hang them out a window and shake 'em a couple times. You'll be surprised how much dirt comes out.
81I heard that there are ruined temples in Kurast. Perhaps you will find the Black Book in one of them.
105I hope you find the Black Book soon. I could use something to read while I wait for my orders.

83You have found the Book! It should give all of us here some insight into the nature of the Prime Evils...

Ah, but as for you...
70Why is the Black Book of Lam Esen like a coffin? Simple. Each holds the shape of our future.
75Thank all that's holy. You've returned with the Black Book! Maybe now you can put an end to the Evil that has destroyed my homeland.
135The Iron Wolves are very impressed by your skills.
74We have the Book. Now we must see if we can bear its revelations.
86You have found a source of information powerful enough to turn the tide against the Zakarum.
89So, you've returned with the Book. You surprise me. You must be very resourceful.

45As I told you before, I placed an enchantment upon the dockside in order to keep the demons at bay. But lately, the enchantment seems to be weakening.

If memory serves me correctly, there is a holy Skatsimi blade that could revitalize the enchantment. The blade is called the Gidbinn.

Find it, and our sanctuary here will remain safe.

66Have you not heard of the Gidbinn? Well, allow me to reduce your ignorance on the subject.

The Gidbinn is an enchanted dagger - a religious artifact greatly valued by the Old Religion, Skatsim.
64Ormus is familiar with the Gidbinn. But how would a powerful Skatsimi artifact aid an unbeliever like you?
66The Gidbinn is one of the few remaining relics of Skatsim, the Old Religion. It is reputed to have great powers.
107The Gidbinn will reinforce the enchantments that protect the dockside from the evil that infests Kurast.

54As far as we know, the Gidbinn is in the possession of the Children of Light. They do not wish it to fall into the hands of those who can restore its powers.

You may not believe it, but Ormus is the one who can use the Gidbinn to protect us.

55I've done some research on the Taan mage-clan, and it seems that most of their magical studies were focused on Skatsimi rites.

If anyone is qualified to use the powers of the Gidbinn, it would be Ormus.
73Don't let the Gidbinn's size fool you. Though it is only a small dagger, it holds tremendous power when in the hands of a true Skatsimi mage.
70Legend has it that the Skatsimi priests placed great power within the small blade. Power enough to repel this terrible jungle-curse which encroaches on our sanctuary.
83If we are to have peace from the shadow, you must find the weapon which will destroy the Light.
67The jungle is like nothing you've ever seen before. Imagine Paradise festering like a wound... then bursting!
145I'm certain that the Gidbinn is very closely guarded.
70Once the Gidbinn is found, Ormus will use it to strengthen the protective barrier around the dockside.
75Since you haven't come across the Gidbinn yet, the dagger must be deeper in the jungle nearer Kurast.
97You'd best get back out there and find that blade. The jungle creeps further into this camp by the hour.
77Hah! You have stolen the fabled blade from right under Zakarum's nose! This is a great day, indeed!

79With any luck, the spirits of Skatsim will grant us revenge upon the powers that ravaged this land.

101This magic ring does me no good.

Here... Wear it proudly!

But now the time has come to face those responsible for the evil that has stifled our land. You must destroy the High Council of Zakarum!

Long ago, these elders were charged with the stewardship of Mephisto, the Lord of Hatred, who was imprisoned within the Guardian Tower.

Through the generations, these pious men slowly fell more and more under the sway of Mephisto's malevolent power and the Council became an evil mockery of its former glory. 

It is Mephisto's Hatred that has corrupted Zakarum and turned its devout followers into paranoid fanatics. That is why you must travel to the Temple City of Travincal and slay the Council.

Once they are gone, Mephisto's hold over this land and its people will be broken!
84The Black Book contains some vague prophecies regarding this undertaking. I'm not so sure it will turn out well for you.
90I am but a potion dealer and an avid reader of occult books. What do I know of the Travincal?

54You must know that the Guardian Tower in the Temple City was built by the Horadrim for one purpose -  to hold Mephisto. Once the Council is dead, you may enter the Tower.

113It has been said that Ormus speaks most clearly when his ideas are utterly mad.

104Remember. You can always find sanctuary here with us.

93The Temple City is well guarded. You'd best keep your wits about you.
100You are incredibly brave to venture into the lion's den. I wish you luck.
95Beware the followers of Zakarum. Their fanaticism is their greatest weapon.
111Kill as many as you can. I have a morbid love of excess.

161The Iron Wolves and I are at the ready to aid you.
139Things are getting wilder than Ladies Night at the Slippery Fist.

80I respect your need to do this. Honor demands that you see this through. Yet your chances are so slim...

125The sun has set on the Religion of Light.
68The followers of Zakarum lacked all sense of moderation. The collapse of their tainted religion gives me hope.

Be cautious, my friend. Though you are mighty, no mortal can stand alone against the power of the Prime Evils.

52Make haste! Though the Three are sure to reunite, it is uncertain as to what they have planned once they do.

Be cautious, my friend. Though you are mighty, no mortal can stand alone against the power of the Prime Evils.

116Move quickly, my friend, and end this curse once and for all!

My men barely survived. I have to assume that the two strangers are Diablo and Baal.

You'd better hurry. They're close to finding their brother.

50The ancient Horadrim always feared that the Three would escape their prisons and unite. I can't believe that I, the last of their Order, have seen it come to pass.

You are the only one who can prevent this, my friend. The final hour draws near.

75Now you rush to face Mephisto. Don't give in to your hatred. That is his greatest weapon against you.

80I'm afraid both fear and a large dose of elixir preclude me from answering.

59I understand that the great Patriarch of Zakarum, Sankekur, now embodies Mephisto.

You must overcome Hatred lest Terror and Destruction claim us all!
77I am loath to describe what will happen if Diablo and Baal release Mephisto.
110I ought to return to the ship. We may have to sail from here very quickly.
110I ought to return to the ship. We may have to sail from here very quickly.
80The sudden reduction in our ranks makes us eager to destroy Diablo and his brothers. Vengeance for the Iron Wolves!
58Why build a Tower to place the beast below ground? At times I believe the Horadrim lacked common sense.
106Shouldn't you be running frantically up and down stairs about now?
96Search the Tower thoroughly. Mephisto must not escape.
96Search the Tower thoroughly. Mephisto must not escape.
55Beware, my friend. Sankekur may be the most powerful mortal in the world. He controls thousands of fanatical worshippers and embodies the Lord of Hatred, himself. His death will be no easy task.
55Beware, my friend. Sankekur may be the most powerful mortal in the world. He controls thousands of fanatical worshippers and embodies the Lord of Hatred himself. His death will be no easy task.
71Your news is great indeed. You have saved us all. I would smile, but I'm afraid my face might collapse.

48You have defeated a Prime Evil in combat. Ormus is impressed beyond words. But staying here will not end this conflict.

You must enter the Infernal Gate and stop Diablo once and for all.
70Ahh... Now, Kurast can begin the task of rekindling its former glory... I thank you.
65Well done, my friend. You are a great champion of Order. Please, consider yourself an honorary Iron Wolf.

121It looks like you're going to Hell before me.

Put in a good word.

42Our faith in you was well deserved. But Diablo has made his way to Hell; and it is likely that Baal followed him there.

Enter the Infernal Gate and kill the Lord of Terror before all is lost. Only then will our world be saved!

43It is good to see you again, hero.

Mephisto's defeat is a great victory for the Light. I knew that you would eventually find your way here. The Pandemonium Fortress is the last bastion of Heaven's power before the Gates of the Burning Hells.

This place has been hallowed by the blood of thousands of champions of the Light, many of whom were mortal, like yourself. Now the final battle against the Prime Evils draws near... and you must face it alone. 

I have been forbidden to aid you directly, save for a few bits of wisdom. For this is the hour of mortal Man's triumph... your triumph.

May the Light protect you and the powers of Heaven shine upon your path...

62Long ago, I swore an oath to watch over the Horadrim and their descendants.

As Deckard Cain is the last of their esteemed Order, I will not allow him to perish here so far from the lands of his birth.

Be at ease, hero, I know that he is your friend. He shall come to no harm.

41Can you believe this place? Did you ever dare to dream that you'd one day stand upon the crossroads between Heaven and Hell? This Pandemonium Fortress is truly miraculous.

However, your journey is not yet over. Diablo still roams free in Hell, marshalling his demonic forces. Only when he is beaten will our world finally have peace.

Hurry now... the sands of time slow for no one!

It was rumored that he went against the wishes of Heaven and gave the Horadrim the original Soulstones in order to trap Diablo and his Brothers.

72Halt! Before venturing into Diablo's lair, go to the Hellforge with Mephisto's Soulstone.

Place the stone on the Hellforge and use the Hellforge Hammer to destroy it.

66Proceed, hero, into Terror's lair.

Know that Diablo's innermost sanctum is hidden by five seals.

Only by opening each of these seals can you clear your way to the final battle.

42There is a dark, tortured soul who was trapped within this forsaken realm long ago. He was called Izual by mortal men, and in ages past he was my most trusted Lieutenant.

Yet, against my wishes he led an ill-fated assault upon the fiery Hellforge, itself.

Despite his valor and strength, Izual was captured by the Prime Evils and twisted by their perverse power. They forced him to betray his own kind and give up Heaven's most guarded secrets.

He became a corrupt shadow of his former self - a fallen angel trusted neither by Heaven nor Hell.

For his transgressions, Izual's spirit was bound within the form of a terrible creature which was summoned from the Abyss. His maddened spirit has resided within that tortured husk for many ages now.

It seems to me that he has suffered long enough. I implore you, hero, find Izual and release him from his cruel imprisonment.

Put an end to his guilt and suffering.

59Though Izual no longer carries the Angelic Runeblade, Azurewrath, he may still possess great strength and power within his new form.

Also, he may not be able to tell friend from foe while in his present state. If you find him, he will almost certainly be hostile.

Proceed with the utmost caution.

54Tyrael has asked you to confront Izual the Fallen? He must have great faith in your abilities!

I trust you know what you're doing... Be careful. You're our last hope.

75You mustn't delay, mortal hero. Izual must be put to rest, but Diablo still lurks within this realm.

Go now... Hurry!

83Having trouble finding the Fallen Angel, eh?

You'd better hurry. It's beginning to feel like some great evil is permeating the air around here.

47Tyrael was a fool to have trusted me!

You see, it was I who told Diablo and his Brothers about the Soulstones and how to corrupt them. It was I who helped the Prime Evils mastermind their own exile to your world.

The plan we set in motion so long ago cannot be stopped by any mortal agency.  Hell, itself, is poised to spill forth into your world like a tidal wave of blood and nightmares.

You and all your kind... are doomed.

53Thank you, hero, for putting Izual's tortured spirit to rest. May the Light protect you and the powers of Heaven shine upon your path.

But, if what you tell me is true, then I fear that we have been played for fools all along.

Izual helped Diablo and his Brothers trick me into using the Soulstones against them... Now the Stones' powers are corrupted.

With the combined powers of the Soulstones under their control, the Prime Evils will be able to turn the mortal world into a permanent outpost of Hell!

68You're lucky to be alive, my friend! It is imperative that you find and stop Diablo!

You should speak of this with Tyrael. He will know what to make of this.

53The time has come for you to destroy Mephisto's Soulstone!

Take the Stone to the Hellforge. Place it upon the forge and strike it soundly with the Hammer.

Only by doing this can you prevent Mephisto from manifesting in this world ever again.

50The time has come to destroy Mephisto's Soulstone! 

Although I picked it up before entering the Infernal Gate, I believe you should carry out this crucial mission.

Take the Stone to the Hellforge.  Place it upon the forge and strike it soundly with the Hammer.

Only by doing this can you prevent Mephisto from manifesting in this world ever again.

70Congratulations, hero!

Surely, even Diablo, himself, sensed the fury unleashed when you smashed his Brother's Soulstone.

48The time has come to hunt down and destroy Diablo, himself.

But beware, the Lord of Terror is not to be underestimated. He single-handedly destroyed the town of Tristram and corrupted the last noble hero who tried to stop him.

This time, you must defeat him for good. Only by destroying the Soulstone which he carries will his spirit be banished forever.

Good luck! Though this be our darkest hour, it may yet be your greatest moment.

54You don't have time to dally about here!

Diablo awaits you in Hell. Remember... Diablo's greatest weapon against you is Terror.

Don't give in to your fears. Resist his power and put an end to him for good!

48The time has come to hunt down and destroy Diablo, himself.

But beware, the Lord of Terror is not to be underestimated. He single-handedly destroyed the town of Tristram and corrupted the last noble hero who tried to stop him.

This time, you must defeat him for good. Only by destroying the Soulstone which he carries will his spirit be banished forever.

Good luck! Though this be our darkest hour, it may yet be your greatest moment.

62Praise be to the Light! You have accomplished the impossible!

Diablo and Mephisto have been banished back into the Black Abyss that spawned them and the corrupted Soulstones are no more.

You've done well, hero. For now, you should rejoice.

42I knew there was great potential in you, my friend. You've done a fantastic job.

Though my ancestors often struggled against the Three Evils and their minions, I've always lived a shut-in, scholarly life. I'm glad that my wisdom aided you.

Now, I wish to leave this place. Though Heaven's Gates are a marvel to behold, I hope I won't have to see them again for many, many years.
To select a Character, left-click on the Character portrait to highlight it with an aura. To deselect any highlighted character, left-click on their portrait.
The buttons located under the Chat Window on the left side of the screen have the following functions:
SEND displays your message to everyone in your chat Channel, regardless of what character portrait is currently selected. This button is activated as soon as you start typing in the Text Box.
WHISPER sends your message only to the character that you have selected. This button is activated as soon as you start typing in the Text Box and have another character selected.

SQUELCH filters out incoming messages from the character that you have selected. Characters that you have squelched are marked with a red X graphic. This button is activated as soon as you select another character.
UNSQUELCH allows you to again receive incoming messages from a character that has been squelched.
EMOTE lets you perform an action that the whole room can <see> as represented through text.

For example, if Doomhammer wants to greet all the players in the chat Channel, he could type, <waves hello.> and then click the EMOTE button. Everyone in the Channel will then receive the message, <Doomhammer waves hello.> This button is activated as soon as you start typing in the Text Box.
c5Gray Textc4 indicates when someone Joins or Leaves the chat Channel.
c7Gold Textc4 indicates the name of the player speaking.
c0White Textc4 indicates what you or others have said out loud to the entire chat Channel.
c2Green Textc4 indicates what you have <whispered> to a specific person, or any message that has been <whispered> to you, in the chat Channel.
c1Red Textc4 represents error messages sent directly from battle.net.

This window on the right side of the screen is used to display and enter both game and profile information. Unlike the Chat Window, this area changes depending on what function you have activated. The buttons for these functions are discussed in detail in the following section:
Lets you form a new game for other players to join. There are several choices listed below that you need to make when creating a new game, although many of them are optional.
Game Name is how you want your game to be displayed in the Join Game screen. It can be cryptic or descriptive, although certain words and names are restricted.
Password gives you the option to make your game Private. Other players who wish to join your game will need to know the password you have selected.
Game Description lets you say something about the game you are forming. This is a good way to advertise for the kind of player or character you want to join your game.

Maximum Number of Players sets a limit as to how many characters can be in your game at any one time. The default setting is 4. You can change the number of players, up to a maximum of 8, by clicking the Up or Down arrows next to the box.

Character Difference sets a range above and below the level of your character that other characters joining your game must fall into. The default setting is set at 4 to determine who can join your game.

To set no level restrictions, click the check box next to this option. The displayed number 4 means that any character joining your game must be within 4 levels of your character. You can change the level difference by clicking the Up or Down arrows next to the box.

Normal, Nightmare and Hell sets the difficulty levels at which you can play. The default setting is Normal. Characters must meet certain requirements to start games with the Nightmare and Hell difficulties. Until those requirements are met, these options will be non-selectable.
Lets you enter an existing game. Games that are listed in this screen are considered Public and can be can be joined any time they have space for a player within them.

Selecting a game from this list will display information on the game, including the characters and the elapsed time of the game. To join a Private game, you will be required to enter the name of the game and its assigned password.

Lets you join an existing chat Channel or gives you the opportunity to create a Channel of your own. To enter an established Public Channel, select one from the Channels list and click the OK button. To enter a Private Channel, you will need to enter the name of the Channel that you wish to enter.
If you wish to start your own Channel, enter the name of the Channel that you wish to create in the Channel Name Field. If this channel does not exist, you will automatically create that Channel.
Allows you to view your character's ranking in the Diablo II Ladders for your Realm.
The STANDARD LADDER displays the top characters, ranked by experience. The default setting displays overall rankings, but you can view sorted lists after selecting the By Class option.
The HARDCORE LADDER displays the top Hardcore characters, ranked by experience. The default setting displays overall rankings, but you can view sorted lists after selecting By Class option.

QUIT closes the Battle.net chat interface and returns you to the Character Selection screen. Although you are still connected to Battle.net, you cannot chat or start games until you have selected a character.
You can access any of these advanced features by entering the following commands in the Text Box where you normally type messages:
Sends a private message to another user on battle.net
Allows you to perform an action in the chat room.
Allows you to ignore messages from the indicated user.
Allows you to again receive messages from this user.

Lets other people who send you messages know that you are away from your keyboard and cannot respond. You may provide a reason for your absence, by typing it after the /away command. To turn off this auto message when you return to your keyboard, enter just /away by itself.

Lets other people who send you messages know that you do not wish to be disturbed. You may provide a reason for your absence, by typing it after the /dnd command. To turn off this auto message when you return to your keyboard, enter just /dnd by itself.

Takes you to the battle.net Channel of your choice. If you wanted to enter the technical support Channel, you would simply type /channel technical support. If you attempt to join a Channel that does not exist, you will automatically create that Channel.
Provides you with a list of the battle.net account names of the players that are currently in the requested battle.net Channel.
Bans an account from entering a private Channel and can only be issued by the Channel operator. Use /unban <accountname> to allow accounts banned from a private Channel back into that Channel.

Use these commands to copy, cut, and paste highlighted text. Use ctrl+a to select all text in the text field. Use ctrl+m to toggle music off/on. Use ctrl+n to paste the account name of a selected character.

Designates the player of your choice to become the next Channel operator, which will take effect after the current Channel operator leaves the Channel and can only be issued by the current Channel operator.
Kicks an account from a private Channel and can only be issued by the Channel operator. The kicked player, however, can immediately rejoin the channel.
Causes a Channel operator to rejoin the Channel, appearing at the end/bottom of the list instead of the front/top of the list. Only the Channel operator can issue this command.
Searches for another player in all battle.net Public Chat channels and all Blizzard games, telling you their account name, account number and current location.
Provides you with your current account number and location on battle.net.
Toggles battle.net Join/Leave notifications in the Chat Channel.
Accesses the general battle.net help text.
Provides you with the current battle.net time and your current Local time.
Provides the number of users, games, and channels that are currently active across all of battle.net.

Provides you with the Ladder statistics for other Blizzard games supported over battle.net. The program ID for each game is as follows; StarCraft < STAR>, Brood War <STARX>, and Warcraft II: battle.net Edition <W2BN>.
Right Clicking on your own character allows you to edit your own profile.
Using the 'Tab' key in the battle.net chat room cycles through the last 10 commands you have issued.
If you need further help, please go to the TECHNICAL SUPPORT Channel on battle.net, consult the Diablo II manual or go to the Blizzard technical support page at http://www.blizzard.com/support/

I shall purge this land of the shadow.
I sense death within this place.
I sense great sorrow and misery.
This holy place has been desecrated.
There is dark magic at work here.
So, this is the site of Andariel's atrocities.
This monastery reeks with evil and corruption.
Even the Light cannot pierce this gloom.
This place has the stench of demons about it.
This tower shall be cleansed of evil.
What nightmarish tortures took place here?
No one should ever be caged.
This is no place for a warrior to die.
If there was magic here, it's long gone now.
Ah, the slow torture of caged starvation.
So cold and damp under the earth.
This place chills me to the bone.
I sense a demonic presence here.
Perhaps now the Sisters will trust me.
The Rogues are safe... for the moment.
This cave has been purged of evil.
Is that enough to earn the Rogues' trust?
Sisters, there was no other way.
This tree is one of a kind!
This ancient tree has an aura of magic about it.
This tree shines with inner spirits.
These stones serve some magical purpose.
Maybe Akara could dispel the mystery of these stones.
I sense many spirits around the stones.
It's as if a great war were fought here.
The land here is dead and lifeless.
What a tragic end to Tristram.
Tristram was no match for Diablo's fury.
All that's left of proud Tristram are ghosts and ashes.
Deckard Cain! Go to the Rogue's camp without delay!
Deckard Cain! You've got to get out of here!
Deckard Cain! Get to the Rogue Camp!
Deckard Cain! If you value your life, leave here immediately!
The Sisters will be glad to have this back.
I should take this to Charsi.
This will help the Sisters turn the tide against evil.
I hope the Sisters appreciate this thing.
Oh, the tower's trove... for the taking.
Ha Ha! This is reward enough.
I've earned the right to this abandoned trove.
I hope to find other such treasures.
Treasure hunting... pffh. Treasure finding... yes.
Heh. This maiden shall inflict no more anguish.
Back to the hell that spawned you, Andariel.
Ugh... The tell-tale stench of a carnivore's lair.
The foul stench of evil assails me.
I sense a powerful undead being within this place.
I've just about had my fill of the walking dead.
I pray that Atma will rest easy now.
What a waste of undead flesh.
Great. An eclipse. This just keeps getting better and better.
What is wrong with the sun?
What evil taints the light of the sun?
Only powerful magic can conjure an eclipse.
Only the darkest magics can turn the sun black.
I hope I know what I'm doing.
The sun has never shone here!
Light guide my way in this accursed place.
I sense strong magic within this place.
This place is as dark as a tomb.
It is good to know that the sun shines once again.
The Light can never be extinguished by evil.
Who would have thought that such primitive beings could cause so much trouble.
What a pity. I was beginning to enjoy the darkness.
Am I the first to find this arcane fortress?
One could get lost in here.
This surely is the product of a twisted mind!
This place actually distorts reality. Fascinating.
This is fantastic! I wish I had time to study this bizarre dimension.
Stand aside, old fool. I have no time for your babblings.
Surely the evil here has driven you mad.
This bumbling fool cannot be the mighty Horazon!
Oh, I hate staining my hands with the blood of foul sorcerers.
That couldn't have been Horazon. Poor wretch.
It was not Horazon. It was a deluded fool who got too close to true power.
This has got to be the right place.
This tomb is very ornate. This must be Tal Rasha's resting place.
Is this the tomb I seek?
This tomb has Horadric markings. I wonder if this is Tal Rasha's tomb?
This could be Tal Rasha's tomb. However, I'm sensing very strange energies here.
Should I enter...?  Diablo and Baal may have laid a trap...
Such a cold breeze... Tal Rasha must be kept here.
Here, at last, is a fitting testament in stone to Tal Rasha's sacrifice.
This must be the true Tomb of Tal Rasha!
I sense an incredible aura about this tomb. The Horadrim hid something powerful inside.
This is not good. Will this madness ever end?
I have failed. Diablo has freed his accursed brother. The world remains at their mercy.
I shall honor Tal Rasha's sacrifice by destroying all the Prime Evils.
Diablo and Baal have escaped me! Next time... vengeance!
I came too late. Now... Destruction is let loose upon the world once more.
I hope the secrets within this book can help us.
I hope this book is worth all the trouble.
The Black Book... It's heresy to the Zakarum High Council.
This tome has the weight of knowledge about it.
This ancient book radiates arcane power!
All this trouble over a tattered book.
May this book lift the shadow from Kurast.
May the Black Book deliver us from evil.
May the Black Book bring a black day to hell.
Once the book has served its purpose, I shall delve into its secrets.
Cough... The stench down here is choking!
The smell of death... or worse... surrounds me.
It smells worse than rotting reagents down here.
It's been years since I waded through sewers for fun.
I hope this does something good...
This will drain out some of the filth.
This appears to control the ancient valves.
This looks like what I've been searching for.
Good. Now I can get out of here and get some fresh air!
This trove will help lift the curse from Kurast!
I hope these items can aid me against the demons.
Great. More junk. Just what I'd expect to find in a sewer...
This dagger will separate the faithful from the fallen.
This holy blade does not belong in the hands of the Zakarum.
This blade shall pierce the heart of evil!
I must take this to Ormus.
This is a powerful weapon. Perhaps Ormus can tell me more about it.
What would this bring from the right buyer?
Hmm... what a strange little statue.
Perhaps I could trade this for something more valuable.
I don't sense any magic about this item. Very strange.
A worthless statue. Perhaps I can trade this for something better.
Such a dark temple for a Religion of Light...
The spirits of nature have fled this dreaded place.
This corrupted temple was once the shining heart of my religion...
I sense tremendous evil within this place.
The dark powers here will no longer poison the land.
The Temple shall shine anew with the Light.
The Temple's dark power is broken!
This must be where Mephisto is.
The final resting place of Hatred itself.
This must be where the Horadrim imprisoned Mephisto.
Mhmm, success! But still, there's something not right.
Maybe now the world will have peace.
The Lord of Hatred shall darken the world no longer.
Mephisto shall no longer darken our souls with hatred.
Good journey, Mephisto. Give my regards to the abyss.
How can one who was once so holy fall so far from righteousness?
He was corrupted to the core. I pity him.
Izual was weak. He squandered his infernal power.
